subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: just joined - where do i start?
msgSnippet: Rick: Welcome back to the group.  I hope you find everything you need to become fully bi-alphabetical. You should try the QS news.  It is not perfect yet, but
messageBody:
Rick:

Welcome back to the group.  I hope you find everything you need to become fully bi-alphabetical.

You should try the QS news.  It is not perfect yet, but it lets you read the latest Assoc. Press news stories with just the occasional "huh" for a peculiar QS spelling.  Here is the link:

http://quikscript.sourceforge.net/qs_american_news.pdf

Constant practice is what's needed to develop your reading speed.

Indolence being a prime Human attribute, I know it is difficult to convince a literate individual to learn a new alphabet, but I encourage our members to talk QS up.  Let others see you using it and answer their queries.  Who knows when it will light a spark in another person?

Paige Gabhart

Risk wrote:

Greetings from Texas!

I have been reading Peter's Alice in Wonderland this last week. It is
a wonderful way to learn the alphabet. Many thanks for making it
available.

I have been absent from the Shavian and Quickscript lists for several
years now, doing this and that. Back then I was more interested in
Shavian, but have come back to learn Quickscript again.

Looking forward to becoming comfortable with it all again.

Rick

--- In Read_Alphabet@ yahoogroups. com, "peter_r_guinness" <malt99@...>
wrote:
>

> do i

> x.html
> But please note that the tutorials use the General Australian accent
